image.altText: White hands close up shot, holding a retro sepia filtered photo of a child in a police hat and uniform looking up at the camera.

props.synopsis: Martin Dole has been a Northern Territory police officer for nearly 30 years — but as the new commissioner, his most challenging role now lies ahead.

title.children: An Alice Springs boy now has the chance to rewrite NT police’s future

image.altText: A close up head-on shot of an Aboriginal woman in yellow and blue striped guernsey, serious expression, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: A fatal hit-and-run case in Darwin has exposed deep disparities in the NT’s justice system, say Aboriginal leaders, as the victim’s family speaks out.

title.children: 'There's no justice': Outrage as Jake Danby walks after fatal hit-and-run

image.altText: A woman in a pink blazer stares into the middle distance

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister is ignoring requests for information about rules for a taxpayer-funded VIP chauffeur service after claiming trips to a pizzeria and golf club were above board.

title.children: NT chief ignores requests for private driver rules after pizzeria trip

image.altText: An aerial shot of white roofed houses.

props.synopsis: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

title.children: Rental prices stabilise but remain at 'record highs', report shows

image.altText: SNAICC CEO and Indigenous Commissioners

props.synopsis: Governments have been unable to reduce the rates of First Nations children in out-of-care and youth detention. Advocates say the new children's commissioner needs the power to hold them to account.

title.children: 'Listen and learn': Calls for First Nations commissioner to be given 'teeth'

image.altText: A young boy in a sporting team singlet plays by a river

props.synopsis: The death of a three-year-old boy in an Alice Springs house fire has led to an electrical audit of Northern Territory public housing, which uncovered widespread issues affecting hundreds of homes, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Alice Springs boy's tragic house fire death yields public housing audit

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile leaning up against a muddy brown bank, with black zip-ties around it's mouth.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

title.children: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut near Darwin

image.altText: A mockup of an architecturally designed building that incorporates gold cladding and lots of windows

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory treasurer says the federal government will not support the proposed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art gallery in Alice Springs in its current form.

title.children: Federal support for national Aboriginal art gallery in Alice Springs in doubt

image.altText: Mobile phone betting apps generic

props.synopsis: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

title.children: Calls for national gambling watchdog grow after NT regulator accusations

image.altText: Text messages are collaged over the protest on the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal NSW authorities were caught off guard by the scale of the pro-Palestinian march on Sydney Harbour Bridge in August

title.children: Inside the NSW government chat group as the Sydney Harbour Bridge pro-Palestinian march unfolded

image.altText: close up of russian soldiers shouting the national anthem

props.synopsis: The Russian president views the prospect of an army returning en masse as a potential risk he wants carefully managed to avoid destabilising society, three sources close to the Kremlin said.

title.children: Russia's 180,000 convict soldiers are causing concern for Putin

image.altText: Unidentified male using laptop

props.synopsis: The spread of child abuse material in Australia has come under renewed focus following high-profile incidents of childcare workers abusing toddlers, and a push by the Coalition to introduce mandatory minimum prison sentences for child exploitation offences.

title.children: AFP powers to combat child abuse 'difficult to fathom' but needed, experts say

image.altText: a profile of Ferras

props.synopsis: A former financial adviser involved in placing thousands of clients into the First Guardian Master Fund says he was given clearance by superannuation trustee Diversa to do so after the trustee initially flagged compliance concerns.

title.children: First Guardian financial adviser says he relied on super trustees

image.altText: Vice Admiral Jonathan Mead

props.synopsis: Australian Submarine Agency chief Jonathan Mead defends the cost of a contract awarded to a US-based consulting group that ballooned to $12 million. Follow live.

title.children: Australian Submarine Agency defends $9 million consulting cost blowout

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian Submarine Agency defends consulting contract cost blowout

image.altText: CCTV video of man about to attack blonde woman on street.

props.synopsis: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.

title.children: In the world's 'phone theft capital', one Aussie decides to fight back

image.altText: A young person with serious but confident expression stands in green parklands in black beanie, t-shirt with graphics.

props.synopsis: Alliyah's decision to talk about their abuse was a brave act that exposed the red flags that weren't caught along the way — and they hope it helps others.

title.children: Why Alliyah is identifying themselves as a victim-survivor

image.altText: Shadow attorney-general, Julian Leeser, speaking with ABC Radio National Breakfast on October 9, 2025.

props.synopsis: Crossbenchers are joining forces to condemn the government's FOI bill, calling for its withdrawal and an independent inquiry. Will the Coalition stand for transparency?

title.children: Will the Liberals hold firm in the fight over freedom of information?

image.altText: Capt Dave Holt, pictured with his son, William in a cockpit of a plane.

props.synopsis: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

title.children: International pilots grounded at 65: What it means for travellers

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: Husamettin Dogan, 44, was the only one to have maintained his appeal after the first trial last year of 51 men, including Gisele Pelicot's husband, in the case of mass sexual abuse that shocked France and the world.

title.children: Jail term increased for man who appealed Gisele Pelicot rape conviction

image.altText: A statue of a woman with a city in the background and a full moon above her head

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A viral gaffe, supermoon shots and vintage cars

image.altText: Police escort a hooded man in handcuffs outside of a home

props.synopsis: Strike Force Flodine is investigating a network of alleged "contract criminals" hired by organised crime groups, and their use of staged vehicles or "kill cars" in Sydney.

title.children: Three alleged 'contract criminals' charged in Sydney 'kill car' blitz

image.altText: Playground equipment viewed through a cyclone fence in sunshine.

props.synopsis: The government says about 40 Victorian workers retained their Working with Children Check despite being deemed an unacceptable risk to children by the education department.

title.children: Dozens of blacklisted Victorian workers stripped of childcare certifications

image.altText: A medium sized green sea turtle lies in sand with seaweed around it.

props.synopsis: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

title.children: Claude the turtle's survival provides glimmer of hope amid algal bloom

image.altText: Roxy Aila is a Brisbane yoga instructor.

props.synopsis: A new national report by Beyond Blue has revealed loneliness and social isolation has reached new heights, with 46 per cent of respondents listing it as a bigger mental health stressor than financial hardship.

title.children: Loneliness a bigger mental health stressor than money for some Australians

image.altText: Cricketer Nadine de Klerk raises her arms in the air, with a cricket bat, celebrating a victory

props.synopsis: South Africa defeats co-hosts India by three wickets in the group stage of the Women's Cricket World Cup.

title.children: Australia remains on top in World Cup after India sink to 'special innings'

image.altText: A woman holding skis and wearing a helmet in the snow.

props.synopsis: It takes a combination of precision and bravery to ski down the snowy mountains. Georgia Gunew does it all with limited vision, her guide and a "pop-star" style headset.

title.children: Steep and icy slopes no barrier for legally-blind skier

image.altText: A man wearing prosthetic arms with boxing gloves stands between two boxing bags.

props.synopsis: Adam Smith became "fixated" on returning to the gym after sepsis forced the partial amputation of his arms and legs. Now he can press 365 kilograms and get back into boxing.

title.children: Prosthetic boxing arms help quadruple amputee back to the punching bag

image.altText: Man in red sweater, cap and sunglasses standing in front of construction works on the Western Highway.

props.synopsis: In regional Victoria, potholes are not being fixed and major rural road projects have stalled, despite the loss of life from accidents.

title.children: Victoria's most dangerous roads are in regional areas

image.altText: Rare earth elements

props.synopsis: The issue has been a key sticking point in the trade war between Beijing and Washington.

title.children: China tightens rare earth export rules further

image.altText: A woman with tied back brown hair in a brown top looks upwards as she is helped out of a white van by three men dressed in blue.

props.synopsis: In sentencing the triple-murderer, Justice Christopher Beale found there was a substantial chance she would remain in solitary confinement for years, which prosecutors dispute.

title.children: Prosecutors say judge 'erred' in giving Erin Patterson parole chance

image.altText: Nina Korbe wears a red velvet formal gown with a black silk cape and sings into a microphone on stage with a broad smile.

props.synopsis: The Australian Women in Music Awards recognised contributions across the music sector, from artists, to photographers, journalists, filmmakers, and leaders.

title.children: Ruby Hunter, Shellie Morris and Missy Higgins among winners at Australian Women in Music Awards

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen smiling in front of a European flag.

props.synopsis: The European Commission president has faced criticism from the left and right after striking a tariff deal with the United States.

title.children: Ursula von der Leyen survives no-confidence votes in EU parliament

image.altText: A man with grey hair poses for a portrait near a leafy brick wall

props.synopsis: László Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, one of the world's most prestigious writing awards.

title.children: Hungarian writer receives Nobel Prize in Literature for 'visionary oeuvre'

image.altText: Nour looks lovingly at Mo while smiling.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Mustafa and Nour Dalloul got married while bombs exploded around them. Now their war-torn love, forged in the emergency rooms of a Gazan hospital, has found a home in Australia.

title.children: Gaza doctor who told the world of horrors finds romance and a new start
